#Hack Library School’s #HLSDITL

Hack Library School is an independent banner that LIS students have been using for networking, mentoring and professional development since 2010. It's an idea that resonates strongly with us, as we are often reflecting, struggling with and learning new tools, and engaging with others.

I've known about @HackLibSchool for a while now, but it was a tweet to their blog post about #HLSDITL that provoked me to jump in. Here's the premise:

We would like to invite all library students to participate in round two of Library Student Day in the Life from October 28 – November 1. Our first round in March 2013 was a smashing success with seventy students participating!

We hope this project, which will revolve around a community of students sharing each day’s experiences for a week, will help prospective students learn what library school is actually like and connect current LIS/IT students with those in other programs. This is a great way to discuss what you’re learning, where you’re working, and all the details that make up your unique library school experience.

Brianna Marshall on hacklibschool.wordpress.com

What a great idea, I love productive fun.

Plus this highlights the accessibility of Hack Library School, which I identified as a wonderful feature of Code{4}Lib in my recap of their midwest regional meeting.

So now it's just about jumping in. I've used the #HLSDITL challenge to get this blog up and running, something I was planning to do during winter break. During the week I plan on writing about class projects and ideas, modern web stuff, and other bits of of interest.

I'm looking forward to reading and getting to know other #HLSDITLers.

Thanks Hack Library School for being open, encouraging, and cool!

  • #HLSDITL

28 October 2013
